Legal_Issue: Whether the Band Council Resolution is ultra vires
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants failed to demonstrate irreparable harm
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to show irreparable harm and balance of convenience
Legal_Rule: Court must determine if resolution exceeds authority of Band Council
Standard_of_Review: Balance of convenience and irreparable harm for interim injunction
Procedural_Issue: Potential undue interference with First Nations political affairs
Grounds_for_Claim: Resolution declaring former members ineligible is ultra vires
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; motion dismissed on procedural grounds
Key_Evidence_Considered: Timing of next election (2010), availability of internal appeals
Applicant_Challenge: Exclusion from by-election due to ineligibility declaration
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles on ultra vires and injunctions
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities, with heightened need for irreparable harm in injunction context
Defendant_Response: Resolution within Band Council authority; no irreparable harm shown
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of resolution, election schedule
Outcome: Motion dismissed; costs awarded against applicants
Remedy_Sought: Restoration of eligibility and postponement of by-election
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Ultra vires action by Band Council
Applicable_Process: Interlocutory injunction process in Federal Court
Governing_Rule: Ultra vires doctrine, injunctive relief standards
